sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: The isempty function returns a boolean that indicates if the argument variable is empty or not. The general syntax for its use is y = isempty(x).

sect1.title: Examples
sect1.para: Here are some examples of the isempty function

para.verbatim:
--> a = []
a = [] --> isempty(a)
ans = 1
--> b = 1:3
b = 1 2 3
--> isempty(b)
ans = 0

sect1.para: Note that if the variable is not defined, isempty does not return true.

para.verbatim: --> clear x --> isempty(x) Error: Undefined function or variable x
